definitions.definition: To apply weight in order to balance an opposing weight.
examples: Big brother counterbalances his two siblings to the pound.

definitions.definition: To match or equal in effect when applying opposing force .
examples: Arm wrestling is undecided as long as the opponents counterbalance each other.
The defenders' knowledge of the terrain roughly counterbalances the attackers' superior equipment.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To apply weight in order to balance an opposing weight.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , figuratively ) To match or equal in effect when applying opposing force .
